glsa.title: LinPopUp: Buffer overflow in message reply
glsa.synopsis: LinPopUp contains a buffer overflow potentially allowing execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: LinPopUp is a graphical application that acts as a frontend to Samba client messaging functions, allowing a Linux desktop to communicate with a Microsoft Windows computer that runs Winpopup.

description.p: Stephen Dranger discovered that LinPopUp contains a buffer overflow in string.c, triggered when replying to a remote user message.

impact.p: A remote attacker could craft a malicious message that, when replied using LinPopUp, would exploit the buffer overflow. This would result in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running LinPopUp.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
